title: alert message not clear when uploading files on a folder and delete this folder from another client
body:
### expected behaviour
when a file is deleted being in used in another client, the message should be something related to this fact, like "please make sure that the file exists. "

### actual behaviour
delete a folder while from other client files are being uploaded on it. the message on is not very clear, it says: "there is not enough space" while there is


### steps to reproduce
1. log in the enterprise version in two different browsers using the same account
2. on one browser select to upload several files on one folder, lets call it a
3. on the other browser select to delete the folder a
4. once the browser is deleted, what happens on the browser where files were being uploaded is that an alert message is shown: "there is not enough space" while in fact, there is 

### server configuration
{"installed":"true","version":"5.0.7","versionstring":"5.0.6 rc","edition":"enterprise beta"} 
open suse 12.2 
sql lite

### client configuration
browser: ff,safari and chrome

operating system:mac 10.8.3

### logs
#### web server error log
```
error	hook	error while running hook (\oc\files\cache\updater::deletehook): sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 5 database is locked	june 20, 2013 16:44
error	hook	error while running hook (oca\files_trashbin\hooks::remove_hook): sqlstate[hy000]: general error: 5 database is locked	june 20, 2013 16:44
```
